name: Smash Remix 2.0.0
patch_notes:
﻿Smash Remix V2.0.0 Patch Notes


[CHARACTERS]


Crash added


Peach added


Roy added to "bonus" slot


Dr. Luigi added to "bonus" slot


Lanky added to "bonus" slot


Polygon Crash added


Polygon Peach added


Banjo & Kazooie
- DTilt active frames reduced (15 → 9)
- FSmash hitboxes starts 2 frames later (16 → 18)
- Dash attack has increased base knockback and hitbox size
- Aerial DSp goes slightly higher and further horizontal drift before descending
- Descending Aerial DSp horizontal drift is slightly slower
- Added dust cloud effect to grounded DSp
- Quick ledge getup attack covers feet better
- Uses damaged eyes in 12CB defeated animation
- Entry animation is faster
- Kazooie tail invisibility fixed
- NSPBackwards animation updated
- Flash graphics added to FSmash and USmash
- Updated various item animations
- Updated facial & shield break expressions
- Updated Character Select Screen animation
- Crowd chant volume lowered
- Banjo CPU 1P nameplate shortened on team and giant stages
- Kirby Hat attack speed now matches Banjo & Kazooie’s
- Fixed Kirby Hat action names in Training Mode


Bowser
- Increased BAir strong hit range
- UAir landing animation updated
- ThrownMarioBros animation updated
- RayGunShoot (ground & air) animation updated
- Updated various item animations
- Updated action strings
- Victory 3 animation updated


Conker
- Updated pipe enter & exit animations
- Updated ItemThrowAirF animation
- ThrownFoxB animation fixed
- Updated facial expressions
- Fixed skeleton tail


Dark Samus
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- CSS icon reworked
- Model reworked, low poly model added
- New green team alt, other alts adjusted
- New walk animations added
- Dash attack length increased to 40 to match Samus/Falcon
- USmash length increased (39 → 49)
- UAir is now a single hit
- BAir is stronger and easier to reverse hit 
- BAir weak hit deals less damage (14% → 11%) 
- BAir sweet spot removed on late hit
- BAir base knockback removed
- BAir animation updated
- FAir deals more damage (8% → 11%)
- FAir knockback scaling reduced (130 → 100)
- NAir uses correct graphics
- DTilt fire graphic slightly raised
- New DSp: Boost Ball
- DSp can roll left and right on the ground
- Aerial DSp moves downward at an angle
- NSp can be charged in the air
- NSp takes longer to begin charging
- NSp shoots faster
- NSp charge shot gets slower as charge level increases
- NSp does slightly less damage
- New NSp animations added
- USp no longer turns around
- Modulated voice clips
- Regular roll sound now used
- Closed fist in Victory 2 animation
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures
- Action strings added
- 1P Victory Image updated
- Kirby hat updated with new helmet texture


Dr. Mario
- Low angled FSmash now deals correct damage
- Mid-high FSmash now deals more damage (18% → 19%)
- Aerial DSp head hitbox on final hit now deals more damage (1% → 10%)
- Grounded NSp now has slope contour
- Model reimported
- New CSS animation
- New victory animation


Dragon King
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- Doesn’t slide as far during DSp landing
- Fixed USp landing ground throw crash resulting from getting pushed off a platform by a wall
- Crowd chant added
- 1P Victory Image added


Ebisumaru
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- AI will no longer try to use NSp at a distance as if it were Goemon’s NSp
- Crowd chant added
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures
- Blush face added to CSS animation


Ganondorf
- Reimported model
- Optimized high poly model
- Added low poly model
- Adjusted blue costume
- Now has expressions for blinking and stun/sleep
- Updated taunt expressions
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures


Giga Bowser
- Can now be grabbed in VS matches
- USp can now slide off ledges like in previous releases
- DSp knockback tweaked


Goemon
- UTilt hitbox size slightly reduced
- UTilt hitbox duration reduced (8 → 6)
- UTilt animation is now 2 frames longer
- DSp can now fail to grab wall when tether is too far into the stage
- Can act after DSp breaks, but loses jump
- USp active hitbox frames reduced (12 → 4)
- NSp charge time increased
- NSp end lag increased
- Grab animation duration reduced (16 → 15)
- Ryo coin can no longer be absorbed by Ness/Lucas PSI Magnet
- New red team costume added
- Fixed invisibility on low-poly Ryo toss hand
- Now uses angry face when throwing other fighters


King Dedede
- Traction reduced (1.4 → 1.3)
- UTilt hitbox size increased
- BAir inner hitbox moved forward, easier to reverse hit
- USp max fall speed increased (100 → 125)
- USp hard landing can no longer be edge cancelled
- Grounded USp slides off of sloped platforms
- DSp startup increased (4 → 12)
- DSp gains charges earlier in the animation
- Waddle Dees/Doos will now turn around when reaching an edge unless an opponent is in front of them
- Waddle Doo’s beam will no longer reverse hit players
- Waddle Dee/Doo duration extended (420 → 480)
- Gordo Duration extended (160 → 220)
- Grab hitbox enlarged and moved back slightly
- Added extra jump animations (body puffs out less with each jump)
- Sounds added to Victory 3 animation
- Hammer face added
- Crowd chant volume lowered
- Fixed deku nut facial expression
- Fixed issue where USp off of a cloud on Yoshi’s Island resulted in a crash


 Lucas
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- Model reimported, light colors changed and low poly model added
- New red team alt, blue team costume updated, other alts adjusted
- Shield colors updated
- Kirby hat display issue with hitboxes/EBC enabled is fixed
- USmash spark graphics added
- Extra effects added to Dash Attack


Mad Piano
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- Crowd chant added
- 1P Victory Image added


Marina
- When collecting Dedede’s Gordo with DSp, now gains 2 charges (up from 1)
- NSp aerial down throw knockback tweaked 
- Pink hair costume added
- ItemThrowD animation updated
- HeavyItemPickup animation updated
- RayGunShoot (ground & air) animation updated, shoots projectiles closer to z coordinate 0
- Jump squat animation fixed
- Hammer face added
- Victory 3 updated
- DSmash spark graphics moved to feet
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures
- Fixed deku nut facial expression
- Sheik, NSheik, and Dragon King use correct animation when being cargo held by Marina


Marth
- Hammer face added
- Updated facial expressions


Mewtwo
- Fixed cloaking device visual issue with blue eye texture
- Entry animation sped up


Peppy
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- NSp: first bullet is now easier to shoot after double tapping B
- Updated facial expressions
- Crowd chant added


Sheik
- Harp victory animation added
- Victory animation 1 adjusted
- Improved cloaking device visuals
- Updated idle blink timing
- Updated facial & shield break expressions
- Results screen name texture adjusted


Slippy
- Moved to "bonus" slot
- NSp shoot animation updated
- Fixed yellow costume getting corrupted during USp
- Training mode action names updated
- Crowd chant added


Sonic
- DownBounceD, DownBounceU, and DownStandD animations updated
- Fixed ThrownFoxB animation
- Fixed revive pose
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures


Super Sonic
- New NSp: Sonic Rush
  Press and hold NSp to fly and home in on nearest opponent
- New USp: Sonic Speed
  Vertical teleport usable up to two times in the air
- New DSp: Sonic Chaos
  Chaos emeralds spin around SSonic and multi-hit close opponents; SSonic loses control for fixed time duration
- Overall air mobility reduced
- Fast fall speed increased
- Weight reduced
- Fixed ThrownFoxB animation
- Fixed revive pose
- Fixed blink animation
- DownBounceD, DownBounceU, and DownStandD animations updated
- Kirby hat added


Wario
- Fixed clamping on skeleton eye textures


Wolf
- Fixed Kirby hat SFX and speed


Young Link
- Fixed crash when boomerang is caught on the same frame as it’s destroyed in a blast zone on scrolling stages
- CSS animation adjusted
- 1P Victory Image updated
- Fixed Kirby hat frame data


Polygons
- Alt colors improved
- Poly Dr. Mario, Poly Mewtwo, and Poly Marth reworked
- Fixed black spots on console by reimporting Poly Yoshi, Pikachu, DK, Fox, Falco, Link, Mario, Luigi, Falcon, Jigglypuff, & Kirby models
- Poly Dark Samus & Poly Lucas moved to respective "bonus" slots
- Poly Luigi, Falco, Marina, and Bowser have added sounds to CSS animations
- Poly Conker & Poly Sonic ThrownFoxB animation fixed
- Poly Banjo’s special model display removed from victory animations
- Poly Falco tail rig fixed
- Poly Link no longer talks during Victory 2
- Poly Marina’s heavy pickup animation fixed
- Poly Ness now properly holds yo-yo in victory instead of bat
- Poly Sheik results screen name texture adjusted
- Poly Sonic’s dash attack is now visible
- Poly Sonic DownBounceD, DownBounceU, and DownStandD animations updated
- Poly Sonic revive pose fixed
- Polygons now use generic announcer call


E Pikachu
- Announcer voice clip updated


Jigglypuff
- Autumn costume added


Kirby
- Fixed issue with inhale always copying a Magic Hat Kirby, even if spit out
- Fixed crash when PK Fire from Kirby connects on same frame as power is lost


Link
- Fixed crash when boomerang is caught on the same frame as it’s destroyed in a blast zone on scrolling stages


Luigi
- Orange costume added


Metal Mario
- Fixed black spots on console via model reimport


Yoshi
- Orange and Purple costumes added
- Tongue invisibility fixed


[STAGES]


Discovery Falls & Discovery Falls Remix added


Time Twister added; N. Sanity Beach, Snow Go, and Future Frenzy added as Remix variants


Dream Land Beta 1 DL added as DL variant of Dream Land Beta 1


LMAO Castle added as Remix variant of Peach's Castle


N64 Remix added as a Remix variant of N64


Pigmask Fortress replaces Osohe Castle


Raid Blue replaces Corneria City


Bowser’s Keep reworked


Dr. Mario reworked


Corneria moved to Remix variant of Sector Z


World 1-1 moved to Remix variant of Mushroom Kingdom


Battlefield DL
- Fixed neutral spawns


Big Blue
- Added F-Zero X countdown voice for the start of the match


Castle Siege
- Clippings updated
- 1P spawns adjusted


dataDyne Central
- Fixed crash when hanging on taxi ledge


Dracula’s Castle/Reverse Castle
- Background updated


Dragon King
- Stage is overall smaller to match original more
- Background is now always centered


Dragon King Remix
- Top platforms now wider to match original more
- Fixed neutral spawns
- Background is now always centered


Dream Greens
- 1P spawns added


Flat Zone/Flat Zone 2
- Added G&W sound effects for footsteps, landing, etc.
- Now skips rendering background


Frosty Village
- Background updated
- Background is now always centered


Game Boy Land
- Now skips rendering background
- Fixed bug where next track wouldn’t play properly when a hammer/star is in use during transitions
- Fixed bug where camera would mess up after unpausing with hazards disabled


Goomba Road
- Shading updated
- Optimizations made


Jungle Japes
- Fixed issue where a star or screen KO with stage hazards on can result in a crash


Melrode
- Shading and blast zones updated


Mute City/Mute City DL
- Updated to reduce flashiness
- Mute City DL camera updated (now same as DL)


N64
- Fixed stage item spawns
- Background is now always centered


Norfair
- Background updated


Onett
- Can no longer clang on car hazard; as such, characters are no longer invulnerable when clanging against it


Peach’s Castle II
- 1P spawns adjusted


Pirate Land
- Bridge texture fixed


Pokefloats
- Fixed crash when a float disappears while a fighter is hanging on a ledge
- Stage preview moved up on Stage Select


Sector Z DL
- Proper 1P spawns added
- Background is now always centered


Sector Z Omega
- Background is now always centered


Spawned Fear
- Acid will no longer KO fighters in Stamina Mode; will leave fighter with 1 HP


Subcon
- Shortened clipping to decrease chance of CPUs SDing by walking off stage


Venom
- Great Fox wings now have lights


Windy
- Model updated
- 1P spawns updated


Yoshi’s Island DL/Yoshi’s Island Omega
- Background no longer moves


Zebes DL renamed to Planet Zebes DL


Zebes Omega renamed to Planet Zebes Omega


Remix Race to the Finish
- Now skips rendering background
- No longer appears in demo mode
- No longer shakes screen for offscreen CPUs


Fixed Saffron City stage select preview fixed (now properly hides fog)


Fixed crash caused by hanging on a ledge or performing a quick cliff attack as it disappears


Stage profiles updated


[MODES]


Remix 1P (Remix Modes)
- Crash & Peach added to rotation
- Lucas & Dark Samus now only appear in their respective stage 4 duo battles
- Poly Crash & Poly Peach added to stage 11 Fighting Polygon Team battle
- Giga Bowser AI no longer dies on bottom blast zone
- Giga Bowser AI will now chase aerial opponents like normal
- New duos added: Royal Rumble, Dr. Mario Bros., DK Crew
- Stage 6 (Giant) difficulty adjusted across the board
- Magic Hat Kirby is now always final opponent of Remix Kirby Team battle
- Star Fox duo pose updated
- Adjusted King Dedede, Lucas, and Star Fox character stage assignments
- Credits music changes depending on character used


All-Star (Remix Modes)
- Crash & Peach added to rotation; Dark Samus & Lucas removed
- Adjusted Luigi, Mario, King Dedede, Ness, and Star Fox character stage assignments
- Dango item no longer spawns
- Credits music changes depending on character used


1P Enemy Player Mode (1P Game, Remix 1P, All Star)
- "High Scores Disabled" properly displayed when human enemy control is enabled


Home Run Contest (Remix Modes)
- Fixed issue where DSp attacks caused round to end prematurely


Training
- Added DI Practice mode
- Added Spam Practice
- Added Infinite Shield Break mode
- Added 'None’ to Shield Break out of shield options
- Added CPU DI Start on Hit option
- Custom Spawns on ledge now correctly prevent other players from grabbing ledge
- CPU teching now always obeys menu setting
- Active Human player port can no longer be disabled
- Any player can now open the Training pause menu (and items will spawn next to them)
- Re-ordered character list so Polygon Wario comes before Polygon Dark Samus
- Fixed dead action string frame count reset


Bonus 1 & 2 Practice
- Remapped 'Set Stage’ to L instead of R to avoid conflicts with setting "bonus" characters
- Crash Break the Targets & Board the Platforms stages added
- Peach Break the Targets & Board the Platforms stages added


Stamina & Stamina Team Battle (VS Mode)
- Fixed issue where star KO’ing an opponent with spiny shell wouldn’t properly end the match
- Fixed issue where DK/Marina dying during cargo hold or Yoshi dying mid-grab would cause a crash


Remix Modes menu added to VS Mode
- 12 Character Battle migrated here
- Tag Team added
- King of the Hill added
- Smashketball added (switch between type "1" and "2" by pressing 'A' on top left)


12 Character Battle (Remix Modes)
- Character are no longer announced when holding token over character & character set is changed
- Set All now activates on L button release so as to not conflict with Settings shortcut
- Player 3 & 4 can no longer pause in-game
- Fixed missing D-Pad indicator with manual stock mode
- Fixed token auto-positioning when all portraits are identical
- Fixed stock icon issue on 12CB CSS
- Fixed 'Best Character’ overlap
- Fixed bug where player 3 & 4 could spam announcer call without entering the screen
- Fixed issue where Z/R button scroll indicators overlapped CPU CSS debug panel UI


Characters (Data)
- Crash & Peach added
- Lucas & Dark Samus removed
- Fixed Marina animations; NSp displays properly
- Banjo’s aerial DSp now shown


VS Record (Data)
- Remix characters no longer affect this screen, restoring Vanilla functionality (only original 12)
- NOTE: VS Record (Data) will still crash on emulator


Sound Test (Data)
- Support added for >999 'Voice’ sounds


Gallery (Data)
- New and edited 1P Victory Images added
- Music added and re-assigned
- Three new drum sets added; drum set order updated


[FEATURES]


CSS reworked; layout updated
- Left "+" bar selects "bonus" characters (cycle with Z & R)
- Right "?" bar selects Random character
- Reduced token jiggling when overlapped


Time/Stock Picker on CSS
- Can toggle between time/stock to adjust multiple categories without exiting to VS Menu
- Changes made in VS Menu and CSS will automatically update the other


Mr. Saturn item added


Stopwatch item added
- Causes opponents to be slowed down, OR
- Makes user faster, OR
- Backfires, causing the game engine speed to change


Pokeball item
- Now spawns another Pokeball instead of nothing if all Pokemon are disabled


Invisibility Cloak item
- Fixed many characters’ invisibility states


Lightning item
- No longer damages struck opponents (1% → 0%)
- Fixed issue where lightning item KO’ing opponent in stamina mode resulted in a crash


Franklin Badge item
- Spawn rate increased on Earthbound series stages


Pitfall item
- Fixed crash when enemy is in throw state and comes in contact with deployed pitfall
- Spawn rate increased on Animal Crossing series stages


Golden Gun item
- Spawn rate increased on dataDyne Central


Dango item
- Spawn rate increased on Edo Castle


P-Wing item
- New graphics added when item effect expires


Ability to hide Pause HUD added
- While paused, press D-Pad Left


Skip Results Screen (Remix Settings)
- Added 'ON RESET’ option


Model Display (Remix Settings)
- No longer affects Intro, How to Play, and demo for crash prevention


Special Model Display (Remix Settings)
- Fixed hitbox display on Yoshi’s Island, 1P Continue, and VS screens


Combo Meter (Remix Settings)
- Fixed minor graphical issue with Combo Meter display


Salty Runback (Remix Settings)
- Alternate input changed to "A+B+Z+R+Dpad-Left"


Random Select (Remix Settings) reworked
- Options are now DEFAULT / INCLUDE BONUS / ALL VARIANTS / VANILLA ONLY


'Skip Training Start Cheer’ renamed to 'Skip Start Cheer’ (Remix Settings)
- TRAINING + BONUS option added to disable start cheer for bonus modes (affects Bonus 1/2/3 practice & Home Run Contest)


Default CPU Level (V.S.) (Remix Settings)
- Can press 'A’ to refresh CPU AI levels with selected value (normally only applies after a reset)


DI added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are NORMAL / JAPANESE / ULTIMATE


Shield Stun added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are DEFAULT / JAPANESE / MELEE / BRAWL / ULTIMATE


Rage added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are OFF / ULTIMATE / SMASH 4 / BERSERK / FATIGUE


Parrying (BETA) added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are OFF / ON


Game Speed added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are 1/1 / 1.2x / 1.3x / 1.5x / 1.75x / 2.0x / 3.0x / 1/8 / 1/4 / 1/3 / 1/2 / 2/3 / 3/4


Special Zoom (BETA) added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are OFF / MATCH END / ANY KO


Single Button Mode added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are OFF / "A" / "B" / "R" / "A+C" / "B+C" / "R+C" (excluding "C" buttons is optional)


All Items R Drop (Aerial) added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are OFF / ON


Move Staling added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are DEFAULT / DISABLED / LENIENT / STRICT / WAIT FOR IT / REVERSE / CHEAP SHOT


Stopwatch Item Settings added to Gameplay Settings
- Options are DEFAULT / ALWAYS SLOW / ALWAYS FAST / ALWAYS BACKFIRE / NEVER BACKFIRE


Hitlag (Gameplay Settings)
- ULTIMATE option added


Japanese Sounds (Gameplay Settings)
- Fixed issue where 1P high scores were disabled when changed from default setting


Punish Failed Z-Cancel (Gameplay Settings)
- Fixed issue where egg punishment could lead to a crash


Air Dodging (Gameplay Settings)
- Air dodge won’t occur if R is pressed while holding an item


'Charged Smash Attacks’ renamed to 'Charge Smashes’ (Gameplay Settings)
- UNLIMITED CHARGE option added


Blast Zone Warp (Gameplay Settings)
- Fixed issue where hitboxes became extremely large when warping


Pokemon Announcer (Stage Settings)
- Fixed "Body Slam" announcer call
- Announcer call updates


Camera Mode (Stage Settings)
- FIXED camera option no longer zooms in/out after pausing
- SCENE camera option no longer affects Home Run Contest
- Fixed scene camera bug when resetting in Remix 1P after beating Giga Bowser


Random Stage Toggles (Stage Settings)
- Remix stages are now sorted alphabetically


Visibility (CSS Debug Panel)
- Fixed many characters’ invisibility states


Kirby Hat (CSS Debug Panel)
- Hats for new characters added for selection
- New characters’ Hats added to Random Hat pool and Magic Hat pool
- Fixed Random Kirby Hat 1P bug
- Hat order adjusted
- Fixed issue where using certain Kirby hat powers in Sudden Death would result in a crash


D-Pad Map (CSS Debug Panel)
- Now respects D-pad held state (e.g. for Kirby NSP, Bowser NSP; also 'Charge Smashes' if toggle enabled)
- Ignore in Training unless "D-Pad Controls" setting is disabled
- 'Smash' and 'Special' Dpad Up now works from Shield
- 'Tilt' simplified; no longer automatically turns you around or UTilt out of Dash
- 'Tilt' now properly rolls both directions from Shield
- 'Tilt' now allows for angled tilts by holding two directions (e.g. FTiltHigh)


D-Pad Ctrl (CSS Debug Panel)
- Pikachu, Sheik, JFox added to Special Angle checks
- Fixed issue with Polygons where during a dash Polygon characters were able to use USp
- Fixed issue when pressing D-pad down while holding 'B', which due to Special Angle check would not be considered 'downward' enough (affected Fox, Falco, Peppy)
- Fixed issue with Quick Attack (previously you couldn't go straight up on second input)
- Fixed Goemon and Ebisumaru USPs; can now move at full speed in upward direction


Poison Damage (CSS Debug Panel)
- In Stamina Mode, Poison Damage will not KO fighter; will leave fighter at 1 HP
- Fixed issue where a KO’d fighter would come back to life in a Stamina battle with Heal setting


Practice (CSS Debug Panel)
- Fixed Master Hand semi-softlock if switching ports while using practice in 1P Game


General CPU AI
- Updated AI configurations for all Remix characters; CPUs are now better aware of their move ranges and frame data
- CPU’s now charge NSp where applicable and use projectiles at long distances. They will also cancel charge when an opponent approaches
- Remix character CPU’s will now perform unique inputs for their special moves (e.g. Sonic’s DSp that requires multiple B inputs, or Marth’s NSp that has up/down variations)
- Giant/Tiny CPU will now have their attack range awareness reflect their altered size
- CPUs will no longer target locations that would cause them to walk off-stage and SD
- NOTE: Vanilla CPU behavior is unchanged


CPU Level 10 AI (General)
- CPU’s can now approach with short hops
- CPU’s can now pivot away in neutral
- CPU’s will try to edgeguard offstage opponents instead of ignoring them
- CPU’s won’t fastfall to prevent SDs
- CPU’s now stay close and attack more often than trying to move away
- CPU’s now randomly jump in neutral, meaning they approach with aerials more often
- CPU’s will now use different jump heights when trying to reach an opponent above them instead of always going for full hops
- CPU’s now have a larger 'view’ range compared to vanilla CPUs, helping long-ranged fighters use their moves better
- CPU Pikachu will no longer use NSp
- Fixed bug where CPU Polygons could attempt jab-grabs, leading to a crash


CPU Level 10 AI (Recovery)
- CPU’s will dynamically detect ledges during the match, including moving platforms
- CPU’s will now try to avoid getting 'pineappled’ by targeting a point away from the ledge before trying to USp
- CPU’s will recover lower and target the ledge considering their ledge grab range. However, if they are not facing the ledge, the ledge is not grabbable, or if a fighter is already grabbing the target ledge, they will not rely on their ledge grab range
- CPU’s will ignore out-of-bounds ledges


CPU DI
- Now tiered based on CPU level
- Now only DI after a strong hit or multi-hit
- DI is now properly applied in non-training modes
- Randomly chosen DI strength/direction/type will persist throughout a combo


[MUSIC/SOUND]


Music slot 4 support added
- Some stages now have a 4th "bonus" music slot
- Select bonus slot music by holding C-Down before the match starts


Menu Music (Music Settings)
- Pressing 'A’ on DEFAULT will now play a menu track from the default menu music pool
- Fixed bug where results screen music could play on CSS if menu music was set to random


Random Music Toggles (Music Settings)
- Remix tracks are now sorted alphabetically
- Fixed issue where ‘Meta Crystal’ setting was being ignored


Attack of the Koopa Bros. added to Goomba Road


Balloon Fight added to Smashville


Battle Among Friends added to Dream Greens, Dream Land Beta DL, and as Remix 1P 'Dream Team’ duel song


Binding Blade Medley added to Castle Siege


Blue Resort added to N64


Boss Battle (Sunshine) added to Delfino Plaza


Bubblegum K.K. added to Smashville & Smashville Remix


Butter Building added to Dream Land Omega and Dream Land Beta DL


Clash on the Big Bridge added to Melrode


Cobalt Coast added to Pokefloats and Saffron variants


Dark Forest Mountain added to Ganon’s Tower, Hyrule Temple, and Hyrule Castle variants


Donkey Kong Medley added to Congo Jungle Omega


Drake Lake added to Twilight City


Eladard added to Venom


F-Zero X Medley added to Big Blue


Foregone Destruction added to Spawned Fear


Fourside added to Onett


Freeze! added to Cool Cool Mountain


Level 1 (Silver Surfer) added to Glacial River Remix


Lip’s Theme added to Dr. Mario


Mad Maze Maul added to Jungle Japes


Marathon 2 Title Theme added to Rith Essa


Murasaki Forest added to Pigmask Base


Old King Coal added to Mad Monster Mansion


Opus 13 added to Reverse Castle


OrangSprint added to Congo Falls


Overworld (Kid Icarus) added to Hyrule Temple


Porky Means Business! added to New Pork City


Redial added to N64


Sherbet Land added to Cool Cool Mountain and Smashketball


Shevat, the Wind is Calling added to Melrode


Strike the Earth! added to Tower of Heaven


Theater added to Winter Dream Land


Theme of Morrigan added to Glacial River


Titania added to Sector Z variants


Treasure Trove Cove added to Spiral Mountain


Underground Theme added to Mushroom Kingdom variants


Vs. Dark Samus added to Norfair


Vampire Killer added to Dracula’s Castle


Wily Field added to "Smashketball 2"


Boss Battle Song 2 replaces Cruel Multi-Man


F-Zero Medley replaces Fire Field


Master Porky Medley replaces DCMC Performance


NBA Jam Medley replaces Team Select


Staff Roll (Super Mario 64) added to Peach credits & Gallery Mode


Music tracks added as menu music
- Bomberman 64
- Crash Team Racing
- Kirby 64
- Perfect Dark
- Sonic R


Music tracks reworked
- Battle Fanfare (Paper Mario)
- Brinstar Depths (previously named 'Brinstar Depths (Melee)’)
- Go K.K. Rider!
- Luna Ascension
- Melee Menu 1
- Mute City
- Powerful Mario (previously named 'Wing Cap’’)
- Raceways
- Snow Mountain (previously named 'Cool Cool Mountain’)
- Starring Wario
- Together We Ride


Music tracks updated
- Aria of the Soul
- Board Shop
- Chill
- Dark World
- Even Drier Guys
- Fever
- Fight Against Monsters
- Final Destination (Brawl)
- Final Destination (Melee)
- Fire Emblem Medley
- Gangplank Galleon
- Ganon Battle Medley
- Link’s Awakening Medley
- Little Fugue
- Mom’s Hometown
- Nutty Noon
- Pika Cup Battles 1-3
- Slider
- SMB2 Boss
- Star Fox Medley (Melee)
- Targets!
- Title Theme (Wild World)
- Waluigi Pinball
- Wendy’s House
- Wildlands
- Yoshi’s Tale


Music tracks renamed ONLY
- 'Battle Theme’ renamed to 'Battle Theme (Quest 64)’
- 'Final Battle’ renamed to 'Final Battle (Banjo-Kazooie)’
- 'Main Menu’ renamed to 'Main Menu (ISS64)’

name: Smash Remix 1.4.0
patch_notes:
1.4.0 PATCH NOTES

CHARACTERS

    • Goemon added

    • Peppy Hare added

    • Slippy Toad added

    • Polygon Ganondorf added

    • Polygon Falco added

    • Sonic
        Neutral Special
        - Slightly less speed and a steeper angle when not homing

        Up Special
        - Height reduced
        - Sonic can act sooner after up special
        - Sonic can double jump after doing a grounded up special
        - Spring lasts longer (3s -> 4s)

        Down Special
        - Sonic can act earlier after jumping
        - Sonic act earlier after going off edges
        - Charging requires less inputs, ground speed cap increased slightly
        - Added weak multi-hit hitbox while charging
        - Retains less Y velocity when starting the move

        Forward Tilt
        - Low angled ftilt reaches lower
        - Damage increased by 1

        Up Tilt
        - Damage decreased by 2

        Back Air
        - Faster second hit
        - Smaller hitboxes
        - Less active frames on both hits

        Down Air
        - Has 2 less hits at the end

        Attributes
        - Air speed reduced (39 -> 37.5)
        - Hurtbox adjusted to be more consistent during spin/ball moves

    • Lucas
        - Special Fall air speed multiplier increased from 0.6 to 0.82
        - CSS image updated

    • Falco
        - Added graphics trail for Phantasm
    
    • Conker
        Down Special
        - Fixed rare glitch where Conker would throw 2 grenades
        
    • Marina
        - Fixed shooting animation so that ray gun fires properly

    • Metal Mario
        - SFX updated for Victory and Character Select

    • Sheik
        - Updated model (slight increase to fps)
        - Updated skeleton
        - Up Special overlay colour adjusted
        - Down Special gfx and sfx added
        - Neutral air animation legs match hitboxes
        - Crouch animations fixed
        - Landing Air B animation fixed
        - Updated forward throw animation
        - Updated character select animation

    • Dedede
        - Fixed Up Special infinite jumps bug
        - Belly enlarged for aerial jumps 1 and 2
        - Belly stays enlarged for Neutral Special turn around
        - Waddle Doo's star projectiles will no longer clang

    • Ganon
        - Up-Smash woosh sfx changed
        - Down-Smash woosh sfx changed
        
    • Wolf
        - Changed woosh sfx for FAir, UAir, NSP and Down-Smash
        
    • Bowser

name: Smash Remix: Wario Patch
patch_notes:
WARIO PATCH NOTES

CHARACTERS

Wario Added
A note from Wario's designer, Fray:
"Wario is the first fully de-cloned custom SSB64 character. He was originally cloned from Mario, 
and still shares some generic movement animations with Mario. Otherwise, all of his attacks, 
specials, and some movement animations are new and he is functionally a completely different 
character than Mario."

Ganondorf
* Forward Smash
    - Inner hitboxes shield damage increased (5 -> 9)
* Down Special
    - New graphic effect
    - Angle and knockback scaling changed for grounded down special
* New 1P Pose
* Heavy Item Lift Sound added

Falco
* Model Improvements
    - Two new costumes
    - New skeleton Model
    - Character model now has expressions
* Grab
    - Hitbox placement improved
* Down Tilt
    - Inner hitbox added to prevent missing up close
* Forward Smash
    - Hitbox placement improved
* Bair
    - Strong hit comes out one frame sooner
    - Weak hit lasts one frame longer
    - Total animation length is one frame longer
* Uair 
    - First hit has higher base knockback and lower knockback scaling
    - Second hit hitbox is larger
* Dair
    - Strong hit damage increased (12 -> 14)
* Neutral Special
    - New animation for aerial neutral special
    - Hitbox size decreased (140 -> 115)
    - Head is no longer intangible
* Up Special
    - Startup frames decreased (24 -> 22)
    - Velocity decreased (102 -> 98)
* Attributes
    - Horizontal ledge grab range decreased
    - Vertical ledge grab range increased
* New victory/select animation
* New loss/clap animation

Young Link
* Model Improvements
    - New costume inspired by A Link to the Past
    - Sword texture improved
    - Taunt hand glitch fixed
    - New hookshot graphic
    - Character model now has expressions
* Up Smash
    - Damage error fixed on weak hit of Up Smash
    - Animation revised
    - Hitbox timing modified

name: Smash Remix: Doctor Mario and More Stages Edition Patch
patch_notes:
Doctor Mario Patch Notes

The Doctor is in this new patch for Smash Remix. He has slower ground speed and quicker aerial speed,
combined with a generally slower, but more powerful moveset. He's packing his pills and has a
super jump that functions entirely different from Mario's. With this patch, Smash Remix has
officially combined with Comjay's More Stages Edition. All of MSE's stages have been added,
in addition to new Smash Remix Stages, Deku Tree, First Destination, and Doctor Mario. All stages
can be accessed thanks to a new stage select design which allows you to flip pages by pressing Z/R.

DOCTOR MARIO

* slower ground speed

name: Smash Remix: Falco Release
patch_notes:
SMASH REMIX - Falco Patch - EXPANSION PAK REQUIRED
Falco joins the fight in Smash Remix. Falco is a bit slower than Fox with higher jumps and a shorter up special. His reflector that notably hits opponents upwards, and he makes up for his lack of a powerful up smash or up aerial with a stronger back aerial and single hit spike down aerial. Perhaps the most notbale change of all is to Falco's neutral special, Phantasm. Falco will use this new special in lieu of his blaster, giving him new options for recoveries and a rewarding vertical hit on the ground. Along with Falco comes two new stages, Corneria City and Deku Tree, as well as a multitude of balance changes for Ganondorf and Young Link. See the patch notes below for more details.

Patch Notes

Corneria City
```
This new stage from sope takes place aboard the Pleiades in the skies above Corneria City. Currently replaces Peach's Castle.
```

Ganon's Tower
```
Blast lines adjusted.
```

Falco (Changes from Fox)
```
Phantasm (Neutral Special) - This entirely new neutral special replaces Blaster and is heavily inspired by Falco's SSBM incarnation.
Fire Bird (Up Special) - Reworked. Faster startup and increased base knockback, with reduced velocity and distance.
Reflector (Down Special) - Reworked. Launches at a vertical angle. Knockback growth implemented.
Grab - Slightly larger hitbox positioned closer to Falco's body.
Jab 1/2 - New SFX.
Dash Attack - Now launches at a more vertical angle.
Forward Tilt - Slightly increased base knockback (excluding lowest angle).
Up Tilt - New animation. Now resembles the up tilt used by Falco's SSBB incarnation.
Down Tilt - Reworked. Increased damage and knockback growth with a much smaller hitbox matching Falco's tail. New SFX.
Forward Smash - New animation. Now resembles the fsmash used by Falco's SSBM incarnation. Kills slightly earlier than Fox's forward smash.
Up Smash - Reworked. Decreased damage and knockback. Reduced ending lag.
Back Aerial - Reworked. Slower startup with increased damage and knockback. Reduced ending lag.
Up Aerial - Reworked. Smaller hitboxes on both hits. First hit has with increased damage and decreased knockback. Second hit launches at a more horizontal angle with decreased damage. New SFX.
Down Aerial - Reworked. Single hit spike with a strong and late hit.
Taunt - New animation. Now resembles the taunt used by Falco's SSBM incarnation.
Attributes - Falco is generally a bit slower and heavier than Fox, with increased jump heights.
```

Young Link
```
Up Special - Reworked. Hitboxes have been readjusted heavily. Looping hits are much farther apart and will "drag" opponents throughout the motion of the attack. Grounded up special now launches vertically on the final hit.
Forward Aerial - Reworked. Weaker attack with faster startup and reduced ending lag.
Back Aerial - Reworked. First hit is more diagonal and should connect more reliably. Second hit is weaker. Reduced ending lag.
Down Aerial - Spike hitbox is slightly smaller to allow for easier intentional non-spike hits.
```

Ganondorf
```
New Model - Ganondorf has a new 3D model and trident.
Up Special - New VFX. Slightly slower startup, armour on grounded up special startup.
Down Special - Slower startup, faster movement on ground down special. Reduced endlag when grounded down special ends in the air.
Up Tilt - New VFX. Slower startup, hitbox is larger, lasts twice as long, and has increased shield damage.
Forward Smash - Reworked. New VFX/SFX. Trident tip hitbox has retained its strength. Lower hitboxes have been nerfed.
Up Smash - Reworked/rebalanced. Trident tip hitbox has retained a lot of its strength. Lower hitboxes have been nerfed.
Down Aerial - Reworked. Slower startup and decreased duration with a much more powerful hit. Launches straight downwards.
Taunt - Updated animation. Ganondorf now spins at the beginning of his taunt.
```
